title: Ecological Psychological Approach for Athletes' Self-Regulation and Competition Preparation

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of exercise physiology, basic theories of sports psychology, and nonlinear teaching methodology concepts
context.additional_context: Developing and evaluating self-regulation strategies through real-game simulations in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can design personalized competition preparation strategies by applying nonlinear instructional principles
Transform training environments using constraint-led approaches to improve self-regulation abilities by over 80%
Construct and validate performance prediction models (math-based simulations) under conditions resembling actual competition venues
Improve decision-making accuracy in high-pressure psychological situations by 30% by applying an ecopsychological framework
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
